Please make sure to inform what fallacy fallacy is besides logical fallacies. How people read content in understanding logical fallacies, but that conclusions even with a fallacy can be true.

Also how people have psychology of how they may view, believe, or trust something besides biases. This includes about misconception with limited info or because of censorship.
The misconceptions are one thing but stereotypes and generalization another.

Something else is how people detect bull. Carl Sagan had a way and method with scientific literacy skills. Scientific literacy I find important part of media literacy when looking at that sort of media mentioning many things in questions.

Very good topic and much needed with today's craziness. The lines between real information and biased information has become too blurred for the masses to come to an accurate conclusion. We gotta teach people how to disseminate accurate information! I look forward to watching this crash course!

Isn't media literacy just... literacy? Literacy isn't just the ability to read, it's the ability to comprehend what you are reading, understand the motivations of the author and how others might perceive it, and to make your own voice heard. I don't get why we need to add a bunch of different words to literacy when it already means those things.
